name: The Spanish Court Hotel

reviews.text: How about free in-room wired Internet with blazing download speeds of 90 Mbps? How about a delicious and complimentary breakfast with fresh baked breads and muffins, with a variety of local fruits and with custom-cooked omelets? How about an HD flat screen TV with 50 local, international and entertainment channels? How about a shower with plenty of hot water and good water pressure? How about 24-hour room service? How about the friendliest staff you can imagine – with everyone radiating joy and offering guests a sincere feeling of warm hospitality? No, although it may sound like it, the hotel did not pay me to write this glowing report; the Spanish Court is absolutely deserving of the praise it receives and its ranking of excellence among hotels in Kingston. There is so much more good I could write about Kingston itself, but to my mind it all starts with this hotel...
reviews.title: It doesn’t get any better than this!

reviews.text: Very well appointed, staff are wonderful and so accommodating. Traveling all the time, my room has to be perfect, they moved me 3 times until I was happy, only wanted to please me. Food was good. Rooms were very nice. Lobby is a lovely place to greet people and just read and relax. We especially loved getting our espresso every morning in the cafe. And Rachel gives a fabulous massage. I highly recommend it..and as you can see from the room, I'm very picky.
reviews.title: Perfect for business

reviews.text: The staff is wonderful, the breakfast is great & the hotel is safe & secure. The restaurant is pretty good & varied, pool area & bar areas are awesome. Rooms are small but are fully modernized, flat screen TV's, strong internet connection, nice group of international travelers. I was here for business, it was perfect with a great business center & its in a decent section of the city. This is really the only place you should even consider when staying within Kingston city limits.
reviews.title: As clean & modern as can be...

reviews.text: Situated in New KIngston, it is a well run property. My room was clean, quiet and spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Public spaces were modern, well designed and comfortable.
reviews.title: A well run, friendly establishment

reviews.text: They went out of their way to make you feel welcome, including the cocktail on check-in. The coffee shop had long hours and there is a roof-top bar. The breakfasts were good.
reviews.title: Genuinely Good Service

reviews.text: This is a perfectly nice hotel ... clean, spacious, great service, affordable, a wonderful breakfast, abundant amenities and a good location, if there is such a thing in Kingston. However, it would be very difficult for me to unreservedly recommend it for a business traveler (And for what other reason would you ever go to Kingston?) unless they fix their internet connection. It was wildly inconsistent and made it nearly impossible for me to get any real work done in my room. And I needed to work in my room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay everything was excellent infinity pool bar was nice with live music by an excellent performer. Don't look anywhere else!
reviews.title: A haven in a rather chaotic city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel. Well located in uptown Kingston (a relatively more safe part of town). Modern and stylish (love the infinity pool & bar area), though already starting to show a few signs of wear (curious to see if it will still look that nice 5 years from now). Staff is very helpful, though not really that knowledgeable about tourist stuff (that's not their focus as it's more of a business hotel). No nickle-and-diming: breakfast and internet are included and the bar drinks and restaurant are reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Best in Kingston

reviews.text: I spent two nights here. Very helpful staff and very friendly. I love the reception and waiting area. Rooms very very comfortable and clean. Mine was in the third floor with great natural light. The price is very good and includes Internet and breakfast. Breakfast was excellent. I had also lunch here one day and it was very good but a little expensive. I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a reasonable price and very friendly staff

reviews.text: Small, elegant (lobby, restaurant), comfortable (rooms) and safe modern hotel in Kingston. But what's most impressive is the people. Starting with the front desk staff, with exquisite and friendly personalities, to the bellman (who offers complimentary champagne, water or juice and shares an intelligent conversation while carrying your bags), to the restaurant staff who's attentive without being obtrusive, these associates are very well trained in hospitality. Stayed 3 nights and my guests stayed 2 nights...all very pleased with the hotel. If this hotel is unavailable, I will not visit Kingston.
reviews.title: What Hospitality Should Be

reviews.text: Hands down the best hotel experience I've had in the last five years anywhere in the world. I’m a writer on a book tour, in town to do the Pon di River Festival. I’m tired, grumpy, and not well disposed to dashed expectations, although I’m used to it. The Spanish Court is what the hotel business once was—grand, but kind; courtly, but human; service oriented, but without servants. The folks who work here actually talk to you. And they expect that you will talk to them. It’s their hotel, their town, you’re a guest. OMG, the difference that makes. Everything works, the food is great, the bar is outside, the city and (Redbone’s) is walking distance so Kingston traffic doesn’t matter. I love the Spanish Court and as long as Lee-Ann Godfrey and her crew are running it I’m never staying anywhere else and neither should you.
reviews.title: Hotels like they once were

reviews.text: Charlie Newton www.CharlieNewton.com
reviews.title: The best hotel in Kingston (maybe in Jamaica)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I work with a Jamaican Company but I’m currently based in Miami and travel to Jamaica frequently for my job. Before discovering the Spanish Court Hotel I always stayed at another hotel but 2 years ago I spent a weekend at this hotel and since then its been my home. The staff has to be the best trained staff in Jamaica, from the first visit you are welcomed warmly by the doorman and the front desk staff call you by name as soon as you identify yourself. Being Jamaican I have to admit that I would shrug off indifferent service since my experience has been that hotel staff in Jamaica have no idea how to treat guests but the Spanish Court management should make extra income training hotel staff in Jamaica. When I visit I’m greeted by name the instant I arrive at the hotel and sometimes I’m surprised by a staff member calling my name when I don’t recognize that particular person. The rooms are very modern, the breakfast buffet is wonderful especially for a vegetarian and the pepper pot soup with garlic bread is divine. The poolside bar on the 2nd floor is out of this world, while you’re there it is difficult to believe that you’re in the heart of Kingston and my favorite bartender Simone makes the best rum punch ever. The spa is amazing and the hours are convenient for someone who works long hours and is always stressed out. Kudos to Lee-Ann the General Manager, Andres in reservations, Marsha the manager of the spa, Chef who always takes such good care of me and the entire staff of Spanish Court.
reviews.title: In the heart of it...

description: At Spanish Court Hotel, comfort, convenience and effortless luxury is our signature trademark. The majestic, Spanish-influenced exterior is enhanced by rich, soothing interiors that evoke the Jamaican palette of black, gold and green. Our Guest Rooms, including a selection of Deluxe, Junior and Royal Suites, offer the ideal sanctuary for relaxation and rejuvenation. Room Rates include complimentary continental breakfast, wired and wireless Internet Access.
